page.title: 06A Visit to Llwynhelyg Farm
page.content: On Wednesday 5th June some children from Y Bont Faen School went to Llwynhelyg Farm. Major Homphrey, the owner of the farm, showed them around and answered some questions. The farm is 1700 acres; 1400 acres of grassland and 300 acres cropland. Llwynhelyg Farm has 89 fields. Occupying the fields are 700 sheep and 950 lambs. The sheep are dipped in March, the end of May, June and July. The sheep are dipped to get rid of scabs or bugs. After being clipped the sheeps wool amounts to over 3tons. The wool then goes to the Wool Board. The cattle are usually sold at the market in town but this year they had the auction on the farm. The cows didn't have names they had numbers on small discs which were tagged to their ears. The cows' extra feed was barley. 700 lambs were sold at the auction for Â£35:00 each.
